titles.title: Helping Young Americans Save for Retirement Act
Helping Young Americans Save for Retirement Act
To amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 with respect to minimum participation standards for pension plans and qualified trusts.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.summary:
Helping Young Americans Save for Retirement Act
This bill lowers the age for participation in tax-exempt pension plans from 21 to 18.
